1.heading: Condorito.

1.series: Condorito) p. 33 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74

2.heading: Condorito.

2.series: Condorito) p. 62 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74
notes: A distraught man comes running to Father Condorito saying his wife has died. Condorito says, didn't your wife die a year ago? Pedro says he remarried, and the priest congratulates him.

3.heading: Condorito.
3.title: "Fiambreria" p. 43 in Condorito, no. 720
3.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Condorito comes into a deli looking for a snack ("la once") and samples enough things that he gets full and walks out without buying anything.

4.series: Condorito) p. 71 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224

5.heading: Condorito.
5.title: "El Final" p. 28 in Condorito, no. 720
5.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Judge Condorito asks a repeat offender what he thinks will happen to him on Judgement Day. He says he'll be happy because all these trials will over.

7.heading: Condorito.
7.title: "Flojo"
7.author: [No author]
7.series: Condorito) p. 23 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75

8.title: "Flojos"
8.author: [No author]
8.series: Condorito) p. 39 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: Comegato is starting a club for slackers, and Condorito wants to sign up.

9.title: "Flota"
9.author: [No author]
9.series: Condorito) p. 43 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550
notes: 1 vertical tier. Nine destroyers are approaching Captain Condorito's ship.

10.author: [No author]
10.series: Condorito) p. 14 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550
notes: The amply built Doña Tremebunda is turned away from the city swimming pool because of a rule against flotation devices.

11.heading: Condorito.

11.author: [No author]
11.series: Condorito) p. 39 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74

13.heading: Condorito.

14.series: Coné) p. 19 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224

16.heading: Condorito.
16.title: "Fuga"
16.author: [No author]
16.series: Condorito) p. 66 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74

17.title: "Fumador"
17.author: [No author]
17.series: Condorito) p. 26 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74
notes: 1 tier. Don Cuasimodo only smokes after a good meal.

18.heading: Condorito.
18.title: "Futurista" ; p. 25 in Condorito Gigante, no. 418
18.author: [No author]

19.heading: Condorito.
19.title: "Ganga"
19.author: [No author]
19.series: Condorito) p. 16 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: Condorito is late for work and argues with the boss about the time.

20.heading: Condorito.
20.title: "Garantizado" p. 60 in Condorito, no. 720
20.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Baker Condorito gives a month guarantee on his bread.

21.heading: Condorito.
21.title: "Garganta"
21.author: [No author]
21.series: Condorito) p. 46 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74
notes: 1 tier. Garganta de Lata sees a spider on the ceiling, and wants his wife to step on it.

22.heading: Condorito.
22.title: "Gato"
22.author: [No author]
22.series: Condorito) p. 7 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550
notes: Sad waiter Condorito brings the shrimp soup to Costal de Plomo, who enjoys it, then asks why Condorito is so glum. It's because his cat died, drowned in the shrimp soup.

23.heading: Condorito.
23.title: "Gato"
23.author: [No author]
23.series: Condorito) p. 36 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: Doctor Condorito has a patient who thinks he's a cat, and can't come into the office because the dog Washington has chased him up a tree.

24.heading: Condorito.
24.title: "Gemelo"
24.author: [No author]
24.series: Condorito) p. 79 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: Ungenio has a new girlfriend, who is one of a pair of twins.

25.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Don Máximo, the toy store owner, refuses to give his son Máxito a toy because it's too expensive. When Condorito offers to buy it for the boy, Don Máximo offers a discount.

26.heading: Condorito.
26.title: "Genito"
26.author: [No author]
26.series: Condorito) p. 12 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: Ungenio tells his son Genito that an avícola (chicken farm) is a drink for birds.
2 tiers.

27.heading: Condorito.
27.title: "Gorda"
27.author: [No author]
27.series: Condorito) p. 72 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: Condorito thought that, at her age, she shouldn't mind remarks about her being fat.
2 tiers.

28.heading: Condorito.
28.title: "Gotas"
28.author: [No author]
28.series: Condorito) p. 7 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: Saco de Plomo visits optometrist Condorito and gets eye drops, which won't hurt anything because they're just drops in a cataract.

29.heading: Condorito.
29.title: "Gratis" ; p. 46 in Condorito Gigante, no. 418
29.author: [No author]
notes: SUMMARY: A new father comes to registrar Condorito to register the birth of a son; after he finds out registration is free he decides to register two more, since they had triplets.

30.heading: Condorito.
30.title: "Grave"
30.author: [No author]
30.series: Condorito) p. 67 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75

31.heading: Condorito.
31.title: "Gripe"
31.author: [No author]
31.series: Coné) p. 18 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: A gag based on a pun about Jack the Ripper ("El Desgripador de Londres")
2 tiers.

32.heading: Condorito.
32.title: "Groserías"
32.author: [No author]
32.series: Condorito) p. 53 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: Saco de Plomo asks theatrical agent Condorito for an acting job.

33.heading: Condorito.
33.title: "Guerra"
33.author: [No author]
33.series: Condorito) p. 54 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74
notes: 2 tiers. The army is beseiged and will have to keep shooting all night, and Condorito wonders how they're going to pay all that overtime.

34.heading: Condorito.
34.title: "Gusto"
34.author: [No author]
34.series: Condorito) p. 64 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: Condorito asks a young woman if she'd like to dine with him, then asks her mother to set an extra plate.
2 tiers.

35.heading: Condorito.
35.title: "Harén"
35.author: [No author]
35.series: Condorito) p. 23 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74
notes: 2 tiers. In a mock-Arabic scene with "Sheik Huevoduro," Condorito complains that one of his wives has left him.

36.heading: Condorito.
36.title: "Honradez"
36.author: [No author]
36.series: Condorito) p. 31 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: 2 tiers. Condorito asks for a big loan without collateral, and says since he's an honorable person he won't die and leave the debt unpaid.

37.heading: Condorito.
37.title: "Hospitalidad"
37.author: [No author]
37.series: Condorito) p. 37 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: Pepe Cortisona needs a place to stay and Condorito says he can sleep with the overseer. That goes okay but the next morning Pepe remarks that the overseer has very cold feet, and Condorito says he's been trying to get the funeral home to come and get him for three days.

38.heading: Condorito.
38.title: "Hotel"
38.author: [No author]
38.series: Condorito) p. 26 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74
notes: 3 tiers. Condorito complains that he hasn't had soap in his bathroom for days.

39.heading: Condorito.
39.title: "Los Hoyitos"
39.author: [No author]
39.series: Condorito) p. 33-34 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550
notes: A military plane has a problem with its wings coming off, and Condorito suggests a line of perforations where they detach, because his toilet paper will never tear where there are perforations.

40.heading: Condorito.
40.title: "Huevos" p. 35 in Condorito, no. 720
40.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Saco de Plomo has a guitar and says he's going to sing in South Africa. Condorito warns him that ostrich eggs can weigh 3 kilos each.

41.heading: Condorito.
41.title: "Humo" p. 50 in Condorito, no. 720
41.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Indian Condorito is preparing a roast over a fire, and the surrounding community interprets the smoke on the horizon as a dinner invitation.

42.heading: Condorito.
42.title: "Humor Negro"
42.author: [No author]
42.series: Condorito) p. 37-38 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550

43.heading: Condorito.

43.author: [No author]

44.heading: Condorito.
44.title: "Increpar" p. 17, 1 tier. in Condorito, no. 720
44.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Teacher Condorito finds a drawing on the wall, and tells pupil Coné it's not a pretty thing to do. Coné says wait until she gets her makeup on.

45.heading: Condorito.
45.title: "Induciendo"
45.author: [No author]
45.series: Condorito) p. 37 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74
notes: 1 tier. Garganta keeps drinking because his wife says she'll leave him if he doesn't stop.

46.heading: Condorito.
46.title: "Infancia"
46.author: [No author]
46.series: Condorito) p. 86 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: Condorito has regressed to infancy, and Compa has to give him a bottle and change him three times a day.

47.heading: Condorito.
47.title: "Insomnio"
47.author: [No author]
47.series: Condorito) p. 17 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: 2 tiers. Coné can't sleep and can't count sheep because his sheep are asleep.

48.heading: Condorito.
48.title: "Interés"
48.author: [No author]
48.series: Condorito) p. 21 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550
notes: 1 vertical tier. Prisoner Condorito is thinking his lawyer is only in it for the money.

49.series: Condorito) p. 22 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550
notes: 1 vertical tier. Condorito, Huevoduro and Ungenio rob a bank. Ungenio doesn't feel safe carrying all that money around, so he goes to the front of the bank to wait for them to open so he can deposit it.

50.heading: Condorito.
50.title: "Jinete"
50.author: [No author]
50.series: Condorito) p. 2 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74
notes: 1 tier, about the boss taking a ride and the horse returning without him.

51.heading: Condorito.
51.title: "Joyas"
51.author: [No author]
51.series: Condorito) p. 49 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75

52.heading: Condorito.
52.title: "Juez" ; p. 31 in Condorito Gigante, no. 418
52.author: [No author]
notes: SUMMARY: A abusive woman complains to Judge Condorito about her ne'er-do-well husband; Condorito sentences him to ten days detention, with an additional one or two months for good behavior. k. Condorito. k. Abusive Women. k. Husbands. k. Judges. k. Sentencing. Call no.: PN6790.M44C568no.418

53.heading: Condorito.
53.title: "Jugada"
53.author: [No author]
53.series: Condorito) p. 50 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: The Hungarian soccer team comes out dressed as doctors.
1 panel.

54.title: "Juguete"
54.author: [No author]
54.series: Condorito) p. 64 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: The saleslady shows Condorito toys appropriate as Christmas presents for an eight-year-old, but Condorito wants something easier so he can play too.

55.heading: Condorito.

55.series: Condorito) p. 69 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: Padre Condorito preaches about a sinner who became a saint, and an old lady in the congregation wishes she'd known him earlier.

57.heading: Condorito.
57.title: "Lengua"
57.author: [No author]
57.series: Condorito) p. 77 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: Professor Condorito says the Spanish tongue is one of the richest, and Treme asks for the recipe.

58.heading: Condorito.
58.title: "Lento"
58.author: [No author]
58.series: Condorito) p. 34 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: The train is so slow that Condorito figures he can plant seeds and cut their flowers at one of the stops.

59.heading: Condorito.

59.author: [No author]
59.series: Condorito) p. 30-31 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550
notes: Condorone raids a speakeasy and takes all their whiskey. After the 5th bottle he notices a funny taste and sends it out for analysis. The result that comes back is: Your horse has diabetes.

60.heading: Condorito.
60.title: "Litros"
60.author: [No author]
60.series: Condorito) p. 73 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: Condorito's cow gives nine liters of milk per day. Condorito keeps three for his own use, and sells the other fifteen.

61.heading: Condorito.

61.author: [No author]
61.series: Condorito) p. 12 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550

62.heading: Condorito.
62.title: "Llaves"
62.author: [No author]
62.series: Condorito) p. 22 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550
notes: 1 vertical tier. Condorito is all twisted up, and goes to a locksmith to see if they can untangle him.

63.heading: Condorito.
63.title: "Locos"
63.author: [No author]
63.series: Condorito) p. 22 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: 1 tier. Condorito is wearing a grand uniform in the insane asylum, to go with his delusions of grandeur.

64.heading: Condorito.
64.title: "Locos"
64.author: [No author]
64.series: Condorito) p. 84 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: 1 tier. Asylum inmate Condorito thinks he's Christopher Columbus.

65.heading: Condorito.
65.title: "Locos"
65.author: [No author]
65.series: Condorito) p. 44 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: One of the patients in Condorito's mental institution is being a sundial, but it's a cloudy day.

66.heading: Condorito.

66.series: Condorito) p. 39-40 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550
notes: A pair of prized parrots escapes, a red one and a green one, and they perch in a tree near Condorito's house. Condorito captures the red one for the owner, but doesn't bring down the green one, saying it wasn't yet ripe.

67.heading: Condorito.
67.title: "Luna de Miel"
67.author: [No author]
67.series: Condorito) p. 49 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74

68.heading: Condorito.
68.title: "Luto"
68.author: [No author]
68.series: Condorito) p. 21 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: 2 tiers. Condorito asks a widow why she's still in mourning after five years, and she says it's because her husband is still dead.

69.heading: Condorito.
69.title: "La Luz"
69.author: [No author]
69.series: Condorito) p. 59 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: The Countess is leaving for awhile and tells her servant Condorito not to waste any money. The Count is sick, and Condorito says if his heart starts to fail he should remember to turn out the light.

70.heading: Condorito.
70.title: "Luz"
70.author: [No author]
70.series: Condorito) p. 6 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: She leaves the light on for thieves, and Ungenio says don't they have flashlights?
2 tiers.

71.heading: Condorito.
71.title: "Mafia"
71.author: [No author]
71.series: Condorito) p. 15 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550
notes: Ungenio tried to join the mafia, but was kicked out when they sent him out for coke and he came back with Pepsi.

72.heading: Condorito.
72.title: "Mal Genio"
72.author: [No author]
72.series: Condorito) p. 40 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: Condorito goes to confession because people say he's crabby, and ends up screaming at the priest.

73.heading: Condorito.
73.title: "Mala Suerte" p. 57 in Condorito, no. 720
73.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Che Cepete says he couldn't visit the Statue of Liberty when he was in New York because it was being repaired. Then Saco de Plomo says the elevator in the Eiffel Tower wasn't working when he was in Paris. For a topper, Condorito says that when he was in Nepal the road was being repaired when he tried to climb Mount Everest.

74.heading: Condorito.
74.title: "Las Mañanitas"
74.author: [No author]
74.series: Condorito) p. 3-4 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74
notes: Condorito hires two tough guitar players to help him serenade Yayita, and deal with Yayita's mother.

75.heading: Condorito.
75.title: "Manicomio"
75.author: [No author]
75.series: Condorito) p. 25 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: A man has been reading a book for hours without turning the page. He can't seem to make out what it says, and no wonder, it's upside down!

76.heading: Condorito.
76.title: "Mantención" ; p. 10 in Condorito Gigante, no. 418
76.author: [No author]
notes: SUMMARY: Condorito as Secretary of the Economy issues a decree prohibiting Ungenio from leaving the country, in order to maintain the country's gross national product. k. Condorito. k. Ungenio. k. Economics. k. Gross National Product. Call no.: PN6790.M44C568no.418

77.heading: Condorito.
77.title: "Mayordomo"
77.author: [No author]
77.series: Condorito) p. 6 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: 2 tiers. The boss gets angry at butler Condorito for making love to his (the boss's) wife, but Condorito says he only does it in his free time.

78.heading: Condorito.
78.title: "Medicamento"
78.author: [No author]
78.series: Condorito) p. 62 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: 3 tiers. When women approach Doctor Condorito at parties for free medical advice, he has a way to get rid of them. He tells them to undress.

79.heading: Condorito.
79.title: "Medidas"
79.author: [No author]
79.series: Condorito) p. 89 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: 1 tier (vertical). The man on crutches fell twice: first into alcohol and then in the metro.

80.heading: Condorito.
80.title: "Medidas"
80.author: [No author]
80.series: Condorito) p. 48 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: Personnel director Condorito is going to take the measure of a secretary, with a tape measure.
1 panel.

81.heading: Condorito.
81.title: "Mellizos"
81.author: [No author]
81.series: Condorito) p. 24 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550
notes: Oscar has identical twin sons, and can only tell them apart because they have different names.

82.heading: Condorito.
82.title: "Memoria"
82.author: [No author]
82.series: Condorito) p. 32 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: An aged Condorito visits the pharmacy, and forgets what he came for.

83.heading: Condorito.
83.title: "Menos Mal"
83.author: [No author]
83.series: Condorito) p. 77 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: Condorito goes to court for stealing a chicken, and gets released on a technicality.

84.heading: Condorito.
84.title: "Mentiras"
84.author: [No author]
84.series: Condorito) p. 81 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: 3 tiers. The characters are bored, and decide to have a lying contest.

85.heading: Condorito.
85.title: "Mentiras"
85.author: [No author]
85.series: Condorito) p. 91 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: 1 tier. The marriage won't go well because he's lying about the future, and she's lying about the past.

86.heading: Condorito.
86.title: "Mesero"
86.author: [No author]
86.series: Condorito) p. 53 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: 1 tier. A customer asks Condorito the waiter what a fly is doing in his meal.

87.heading: Condorito.
87.title: "Miedo"
87.author: [No author]
87.series: Condorito) p. 84 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: 3 tiers. A passenger lectures a nervous Condorito about how safe air travel actually is, and Condorito thanks him for his words and returns to the cockpit to land the plane.

88.heading: Condorito.
88.title: "Milagro"
88.author: [No author]
88.series: Condorito) p. 7-8 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74
notes: Condorito wins a big insurance settlement for a suspicious injury, and the other lawyer is so angry he plans to follow him until he gets out of his wheelchair. Condorito's first stop is going to be Lourdes, however. Appearance of Comegato.

89.heading: Condorito.
89.title: "Moda"
89.author: [No author]
89.series: Condorito) p. 51 in Condorito de Oro, no. 224
notes: Summary: The elevator goes so fast that her panties drop to her ankles.
3 tiers.

90.heading: Condorito.
90.title: "Montaña Ruso" p. 54, 1 tier in Condorito, no. 720
90.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Condorito wants to take a picture Yuyito and Coné riding the roller coaster, and tells them to smile and hold still.

91.heading: Condorito.
91.title: "Montañista"
91.author: [No author]
91.series: Condorito) p. 14 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: Condorito accomplishes a difficult mountain climb, while Coné plays with his friends. At the top, Condorito finds a snowman the kids have built.

92.heading: Condorito.

298.heading: Condorito--Articles About.
298.title: "El Cóndor Pasa"
298.author: Jorge Montealegre Iturra
298.appears_in: p. 51-54 in La Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios sobre la Historieta, v. 1, no. 1 (Abril 2001).
notes: Resumen: "Condorito es el personaje más popular de la historieta chilena y el más internacional. Ya tiene más de 50 años y es un ícono representativo de Chile. ¿Por qué? La representación humanizada del cóndor ha estado en el imaginario de los habitantes de Chile, desde antes que los europeos 'descubrieran' el Nuevo Mundo. El artículo demuestra que desde el arte rupestre hasta el personaje de Pepo ha habido varios otros 'condoritos' en la historia del humor gráfico de Chile."

Abstract: Condorito is the most popular and international character in Chilean comics. He is more than 50 years old, and is a representative Chilean icon. Why? The anthropomorphic representation of the Condor has been in the collective imagination of Chileans since before the 'discovery' of the New World by the Europeans. This article shows that from rupestrian art up to Pepo's character, there have been many 'condoritos' in the history of Chilean graphic humor.
Abstracts as printed with the article, with some editing of the English.
Includes illustrations.

299.heading: Condorito--Miscellanea.
299.title: "La Historieta en Chile, 2"
299.author: Cristian Eric Díaz Castro
299.appears_in: p. 153-176 in Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios sobre la Historieta, v. 2, no. 7 (Sept. 2002).
notes: Covers the period 1924-1949.

Resumen: "En este periodo los cómics extranjeros marcaban la pauta para la producción nacional y tímidamente se acepta el uso del bocadillo en las viñetas. El estilo de dibujo es clásico, monótono y de varias calidades pero algunos autores juegan con los estilos y se destacan nombres como Jorge Delano, Christie, Core, Percy, Nato, Alhue, y Pepo. Ester periodo comienza con la llegada de los suplementos de cómics como Don Fausto, pasando por la época de gloria de El Peneca, y Topaze, y sus imitaciones, y termina con la aparición del más famoso de los personajes de cómics chilenos: Condorito."

Summary: "In this period foreign comic strips were setting the pattern for Chilean comic book production and the use of the balloon in panels is hesitantly accepted. The drawing style is classic, monotonous and of many levels of quality, but some cartoonists try new ways and some names stand out, like Jorge Delano, Christie, Core, Percy, Nato, Alhue, and Pepo. This period of time begins with the arrival of weekly comics magazines like Don Fausto and goes up to the golden age of El Peneca and Topaze and their imitations. This era ends with the publication of the most famous Chilean comic book character: Condorito."
Abstracts as published with the article, with some editing of the English.
Includes illustrations.

300.heading: Condorito--Miscellanea.
300.title: "La Historieta en Chile
300.author: Cristian Eric Díaz Castro
300.appears_in: p. 251-260 in Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios sobre la Historieta, v. 3, no. 12 (Diciembre 2003).
notes: This installment covers the years 1981-1986.

Resumen: "'Condorito' logra su aún cresciente estatus internacional cuando es vendido a un sindicato. Muchas experiencias editoriales tratan de dar un nuevo aliento de vide enel medio historietistico pero tienen corta vida. En las universidades una nueva raza de narradores gráficos aparece. El cómic alternativo chileno había aparecido. Pero la nostalgia por antiguos personajes permittria a los historietists clásicos hacer su mejor esfuerzo por mantener el medio vivo."

Abstract: "'Condorito' gains its still growing international status when it is sold to a syndicate. Many publishing experiments try to give a breath of new life to the comics medium, but they are short lived. In the universities a new generation of graphic authors appears. Chilean alternative comics appear. Nostalgia for the old characters, however, lets the classic cartoonists do their best to keep the medium alive."
Abstracts as printed with the article, with some editing of the English.

301.heading: Condorito--Miscellanea.
301.title: "La Historieta en Chile, 10"
301.author: Cristian Eric Díaz Castro
301.appears_in: p. 21-60 in Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios Sobre la Historieta, v. 5, no. 17 (Mar. 2005). "Resumen: En Chile hay excelentes guionistas, dibujantes de comics, ilustradores, narradores gráficos, pero lo anecdótico de todo es que no hay un mercado para el cómic nacional. Los artistas están dibujando para las convenciones de comics, infructosos intentos para revivir los años dorados del noveno arte chilena. Sin embargo internet les permite mostrar sus trabajos al mundo donde serán comprados por el mejor postor. En este doloroso tiempo los nacientes dibujantes de comics usan al fanzin como el medio más expedito para mantener viva la cultura comiquera. El único que sigue firme en el medio como icono historietistico apoyado en rentables ventas es el insípido pero exitoso y eficaz Condorito."
notes: Abstract: In Chile there are excellent writers, cartoonists, illustrators, graphic storytellers, but in spite of this there is no national market for Chilean comics. The artists draw for comics conventions, vainly trying to revive the golden years of the Chilean ninth art, though the internet lets them show their art to the world and sell to the highest bidder. In this sad time emerging cartoonists use fanzines as the best way to keep the comic book culture alive. The only title that stands firm as a best-selling comic book icon is the insipid but successful Condorito.
Abstracts as printed with the article, with some editing of the English.

302.heading: Condorito--Miscellanea.
302.title: "Pepo, mucho más que un Condorito"
302.author: Jorge Montealegre Iturra
302.appears_in: p. 46-50 in La Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios sobre la Historieta, v. 1, no. 1 (Abril 2001).
notes: Resumen: "En julio del año 2000, a los 88 años, falleció Pepo (René Ríos), probablemente el dibujante humoristico chileno más completo del siglo XX. Se destacó en el humor político, deportivo, picaresco y para niños. También en la ilustración de libros y en la publicidad. Condorito, su personaje de mayor trascendencia no es la única huella de Pepo en la historia del humor gráfico de Chile, dejando un patrimonio iconográfico fundamental que ilustra la 'chilenidad cotidiana' de al menos medio siglo de nuestra historia."

Abstract: Pepo (René Ríos) died in July 2000, at the age of 88, probably the most prominent Chilean cartoonist and the most complete Chilean graphic artist of the 20th century. He was outstanding in political, sports, adult and children's cartooning, as well as in book illustrations and advertising. Condorito, his best-known character, is not his only legacy in the history of Chilean graphic humor. He also left a very important iconographic patrimony that illustrates at least half a century of Chilean daily history.
Abstracts as printed with the article, with some editing of the English.
Includes illustrations.

"Friends are our most valuable possession, that is the lesson these Jataka tales impart. The wise, like Nigrodha Kumar, cherish their companions. Pottik's selfless loyalty is rewarded by unexpected riches. On the other hand, for the selfish ingrate Shakha there awaits only a shameful loneliness. Rich or poor, ugly or handsome, powerful or helpless, a friend is one whom you can trust. And for this luxury, you should repay your friend with respect and honour."
